noun.description: The feeling that someone or something is unworthy of one's consideration or respect; contempt.
examples: her upper lip curled in disdain
an aristocratic disdain for manual labor

verb.description: Consider to be unworthy of one's consideration.

origin: Middle English: from Old French desdeign (noun), desdeignier (verb), based on Latin dedignari, from de- (expressing reversal) + dignari consider worthy (from dignus worthy).
